definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: I am sailing against waves and squalls on the rough icy sea.
sentences.chinese: 迎着风浪，冒着沉没的危险，我在冰海中艰难地航行。

sentences.english: In what direction should the pilot head in order to travel due north ?
sentences.chinese: 为使这架飞机向正北航行，驾驶员应取什么航向？

sentences.english: But the Separatists discovered that the Speedwell leaked and therefore could not make the journey.
sentences.chinese: 可是分离派发现斯碧薇尔号漏水了，所以无法航行。

sentences.english: The navigation rules and tonnage regulation of Panama Canal.
sentences.chinese: 巴拿马运河的航行和吨位规定。

sentences.english: He passaged to New York last month.
Objective The conditions of Ceratopogonidae carried by entry international ocean ships were determined.
sentences.chinese: 目的了解入境国际航行船舶携带输入性蠓类的情况。

sentences.english: The Voyage of Captain Woodes Rogers, round the world.
sentences.chinese: 上尉的伍兹罗杰斯环球航行。

sentences.english: The steamer will go west by north.
sentences.chinese: 这艘轮船将向西偏北方向航行。

sentences.english: The brave young man voyaged single-handed in his yacht for months.
sentences.chinese: 勇敢的年轻人独自乘游艇航行数月。

sentences.english: Voyager was heading for an ocean storm.
sentences.chinese: “航行者”号正驶向一个大洋风暴。

sentences.english: During the voyage, he was terribly seasick and deported back to his home ahead of time.
sentences.chinese: 因航行途中晕船厉害，被提前遣送回乡。

sentences.english: We can see warships sailing on the sea.
sentences.chinese: 我们能看到军舰在海上航行。

sentences.english: Hudson sailed farther north and west than any European before him.
sentences.chinese: 哈德逊比他以前的任何欧洲人航行的往北，往西。

sentences.english: They have made many trips traveling both north and south on the eastern intercoastal waterway.
sentences.chinese: 他们在东海岸内陆航道上有过反复多次的南北航行。

sentences.english: The boat turned to the South and rampaged along.

definition: to return to the point of departure
